site_name: R M R S MANUFACTURING & DISTRIBUTING INC

citations.narrative:
Individual medical records for dogs do not include when problems are identified, the date and description of the problem,
examination findings, test results, if ran, their plan for treatment and care, and the treatment procedures performed. For
example, a young English bulldog, Olive, was identified by the care staff with a mild rash on her abdomen. The facility
initiated treatment in correspondence with the attending veterinarian, but no records exist regarding the observation or
initiation of treatment. Incomplete medical records do not allow the attending veterinarian to verify the facility is following
appropriate veterinary guidance and ensure humane handling of all animals in their care. Correct by ensuring that when a
problem is identified in a dog (such as disease, injury, or illness), the date and description of the problem, examination
findings, test results, plan for treatment and care, and treatment procedures performed are recorded in the medical
records. Correct by November 8, 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
Although the facility provides types of enrichment for their birds, the facility does not have a completely developed and
documented environmental enhancement plan for birds. Failure to develop and document an environmental enhancement
program for birds can negatively impact their health and well-being, causing unnecessary psychological distress. Correct
by developing, documenting, and following a species-appropriate plan for environmental enhancement that is adequate to
promote the psychological well-being of the birds. The plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian and must be
in accordance with the regulations in subpart G and with currently accepted professional standards as cited in appropriate
professional journals and reference guides. This plan must be made available to APHIS upon request. The plan must
address each category listed in 3.154. Correct by November 10, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
